intro: Chaydaia crenulata, commonly known as the crested chaydaia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Chaydaia crenulata thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. It is often found in alpine meadows and is valued for its ornamental foliage and ecological role in supporting pollinators.
